meanings.sent1: She predestined her path to success by setting clear goals.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller claimed to predestine the future of her clients.
meanings.sent3: It was as if her morning routine predestined a good day ahead.
meanings.sent4: The ancient prophecy seemed to predestine the rise of a new ruler.
meanings.sent5: His hard work and dedication predestined him for greatness.

meanings.sent1: The teacher predestined the roles for the school play.
meanings.sent2: The company predestined the next CEO long before the announcement.
meanings.sent3: The cat's habit of sitting on the same spot seemed to predestine it as her favorite.
meanings.sent4: The weather forecast seemed to predestine a rainy weekend.
meanings.sent5: The chef would predestine the menu for the week on Sundays.

meanings.sent1: The ancient prophecy seemed to predestine the rise of a new ruler.
meanings.sent2: Some believe that fate predestines our every move.
meanings.sent3: The way the cards fell seemed to predestine his victory in the game.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to predestine their love story.
meanings.sent5: The decision to study hard would predestine his success in the exam.
